content.description: A large school district held a district-wide track meet for all high school students. For the 2-mile run, the population of female students participating had a mean running time of 8.8 minutes with standard deviation of 3.3 minutes, and the population of male students participating had a mean running time 7.3 minutes with standard deviation of 2.9 minutes. Suppose 8 female students and 8 male students who participated in the 2-mile run are selected at random from each population. Let <math alttext="x bar sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sample mean running time for the female students, and let <math alttext="x bar sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sample mean running time for the male students.
content.question: What are the mean and standard deviation of the sampling distribution of the difference in sample means <math alttext="x bar sub F minus x bar sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The mean is 0.4, and the standard deviation is <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 8.8 over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction 7.3 over 8, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>8.8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7.3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The mean is 0.4, and the standard deviation is <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 8.8 squared over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction 7.3 squared over 8, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>8.8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>7.3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The mean is 1.5, and the standard deviation is <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 3.3 squared over 8, end fraction, minus the fraction 2.9 squared over 8, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3.3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The mean is 1.5, and the standard deviation is <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 3.3 over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction 2.9 over 8, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3.3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The mean is 1.5, and the standard deviation is <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 3.3 squared over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction 2.9 squared over 8, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3.3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The mean is 1.5, and the standard deviation is <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 3.3 squared over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction 2.9 squared over 8, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3.3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
